text:
System Configuration:
=====================
Intel Pentium 4, 3.06GHz , 2GB RAM

Apache RPM Installed:
=====================
apache2-mod-php-4-4.3.10-14
apache2-prefork 2.0.53-9
apache2-devel-2.0.53-9.10
PHP-5.1.1 is compiled 

Description:
=============

With default server tuning settings for apache when i start apache i see the
apache processes running as httpd2-prefork <defunct>.

I tried re-installing apache but the problem still exits. With this
configuration when 5 processes are running even before hitting the cpu loadavg
increases. it goes as high as 55. Each process of apache uses around 35% of cpu.
creator: namithajr@gmail.com

text:
There's no way anyone can reproduce your problem (let alone fix it) from that
description.  You need to find out what is causing it.  From the little bit of
information you posted the most likely culprit is something-PHP, but the PHP
folks won't be able to do anything with such a nebulous report, either.

Furthermore, you're using a third-party apache package of an apache version
that's several years out of date.  You should try with a clean apache
installation before reporting here, unless you can identify a specific bug.
creator: nick@webthing.com
